results.title: Treadmill Exercise Stress Test-Induced Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy: A Case Report and Review of Literature
results.text_hl: An abnormal stress test necessitated coronary angiography, which revealed nonobstructive coronaries with apical left ventricular ballooning and a decreased ejection fraction (EF), both of which are concerning for @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@TTS@@@. The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was medically managed with @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, with improvement in the EF on the follow-up echocardiogram.

citations.NLM: Singh A, Singh D. Treadmill Exercise Stress Test-Induced Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy: A Case Report and Review of Literature Cureus. 2023 Jan;15(1):e33426. PMID: 36751260
citations.BibTeX: @article{36751260, title={Treadmill Exercise Stress Test-Induced Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy: A Case Report and Review of Literature}, author={Singh A and Singh D}, journal={Cureus}, volume={15}, number={1}, pages={e33426}}

results.title: Recurrent biventricular takotsubo cardiomyopathy with fatal outcome.
results.text_hl: Recurrent @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@biventricular takotsubo cardiomyopathy@@@ with fatal outcome.

citations.NLM: Osman AF, Khor SY, Abdelazeem B, Barham W. Recurrent biventricular takotsubo cardiomyopathy with fatal outcome. BMJ Case Rep. 2022 Sep 19;15(9):. PMID: 36123009

results.title: Case Report of High-Grade Atrioventricular Block and Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy.
results.text_hl: INTRODUCTION: @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@Takotsubo cardiomyopathy@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@TTC@@@) is a condition with a good long-term prognosis.

citations.NLM: Prasad R, Salam MF, Srivastava S, Samreen F, Baloch ZQ. Case Report of High-Grade Atrioventricular Block and Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy. Perm J. 2021 May 12;25():. PMID: 35348088

results.title: Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy as a Cardiovascular Manifestation of COVID-19: A Case Report and Literature Review
results.text_hl: The Mayo clinic criteria are used for the diagnosis of @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@TCM@@@ - all four criteria must be present for the diagnosis of @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@TCM@@@.

citations.NLM: Noor F, Ogunleye OO, Ajibola O, Malik S, Cluzet V. Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy as a Cardiovascular Manifestation of COVID-19: A Case Report and Literature Review Cureus. 2022 Oct;14(10):e30005. PMID: 36348889
citations.BibTeX: @article{36348889, title={Takotsubo Cardiomyopathy as a Cardiovascular Manifestation of COVID-19: A Case Report and Literature Review}, author={Noor F and Ogunleye OO and Ajibola O and Malik S and Cluzet V}, journal={Cureus}, volume={14}, number={10}, pages={e30005}}

results.title: The role of plasminogen activation in smooth muscle cell migration after arterial injury.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@, an inhibitor of @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@, inhibited smooth muscle cell migration after @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@balloon injury@@@ by 78% (p < 0.01) but did not influence plasminogen-activator activity.

citations.NLM: Jackson CL, Reidy MA. The role of plasminogen activation in smooth muscle cell migration after arterial injury. Ann N Y Acad Sci. 1992 Dec 4;667():141-50. PMID: 1339242
citations.BibTeX: @article{1339242, title={The role of plasminogen activation in smooth muscle cell migration after arterial injury.}, author={Jackson CL and Reidy MA}, journal={Ann N Y Acad Sci}, volume={667}, pages={141-50}}

results.title: Extra-adrenal pheochromocytoma presenting as inverse takotsubo-pattern cardiomyopathy treated with surgical resection.
results.text_hl: These @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumours@@@ can present as transient, reversible @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@cardiomyopathy@@@ similar to @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@takotsubo cardiomyopathy@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@TCM@@@).

citations.NLM: Tafreshi S, Naqvi SY, Thomas S. Extra-adrenal pheochromocytoma presenting as inverse takotsubo-pattern cardiomyopathy treated with surgical resection. BMJ Case Rep. 2018 Dec 9;11(1):. PMID: 30567218

results.title: Elevated vascular angiotensin converting enzyme mediates increased neointima formation after balloon injury in spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor treatment with 10 mg/kg body weight @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ daily for 14 days by gavage reduced @DISEASE_Neointima @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointima@@@ proliferation in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ and normotensive @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (@DISEASE_Neointima @DISEASE_MESH:D058426 @@@neointima@@@: media ratio: 0.35 +/- 0.02 for SHR, P < 0.01, versus untreated SHR with @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@balloon injury@@@; 0.28 +/- 0.01 for SD, P < 0.01, versus untreated SD @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Takotsubo_Cardiomyopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054549 @@@balloon injury@@@).

citations.NLM: Jandeleit-Dahm K, Burrell LM, Johnston CI, Koch KM. Elevated vascular angiotensin converting enzyme mediates increased neointima formation after balloon injury in spontaneously hypertensive rats. J Hypertens. 1997 Jun;15(6):643-50. PMID: 9218184
citations.BibTeX: @article{9218184, title={Elevated vascular angiotensin converting enzyme mediates increased neointima formation after balloon injury in spontaneously hypertensive rats.}, author={Jandeleit-Dahm K and Burrell LM and Johnston CI and Koch KM}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={15}, number={6}, pages={643-50}}
